SEARCH
Module org.example.game
Package engine.input

Class InputHandler

java.lang.Object
engine.input.InputHandler
public class InputHandler extends Object
Handles user input events: keyboard and mouse interactions.

Delegates input to the UI when craft or pause menus are active, otherwise translates events into game actions such as movement, interaction, mining, and placing tiles.

  • Constructor Details

    • InputHandler

      public InputHandler(Player player, LevelManager lvlMgr, UIManager uiMgr, List<NPC> npcs)
      Constructs an InputHandler to process user events.
      Parameters:
      player - the player entity to control
      lvlMgr - the level manager for world interactions
      uiMgr - the UI manager to handle menu states
      npcs - the list of NPCs for interaction events

  • Method Details

    • handleKeyPress

      public void handleKeyPress(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent e)
      Processes key press events.

      If the crafting menu is open, forwards the event to the crafting UI. If the game is paused, forwards the event to the pause UI. Otherwise handles movement, actions, and UI toggles.

      Parameters:
      e - the KeyEvent representing the key press

    • handleKeyRelease

      public void handleKeyRelease(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent e)
      Processes key release events for movement keys.

      Stops player movement when left or right keys are released.

      Parameters:
      e - the KeyEvent representing the key release

    • handleMousePress

      public void handleMousePress(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e)
      Processes mouse press events for mining and placing tiles.

      Left-click mines a tile at the cursor position. Right-click places a dirt tile at the cursor position. Coordinates are translated from screen to world space.

      Parameters:
      e - the MouseEvent representing the mouse button press

    • handleMouseRelease

      public void handleMouseRelease(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e)
      Processes mouse release events.

      Currently not used, but provided for completeness and future extensions.

      Parameters:
      e - the MouseEvent representing the mouse button release
